org.gearman

Interface GearmanJoin<A>

  • Type Parameters:
    A - The attachment type

    public interface GearmanJoin<A>
    The GearmanJoin class is used to block the current thread until a job has completed and been completly proccessed. A call to the join() method will block until the GearmanJobEventCallback returns from processing the End-Of-File event.
    Author:
    isaiah van der elst

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      A getAttachment()
      Returns the object attached to the job.
      boolean isEOF()
      Returns true if the eof has been reached and all events have been processed
      void join()
      Blocks the current thread until the job's eof has been reached and all events have been processed
      void join(long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Blocks the current thread until the job's eof has been reached and all events have been processed or until the given timeout elapses

    • Method Detail

      • getAttachment

        A getAttachment()
        Returns the object attached to the job. This value can be used to identify a specific job with a the GearmanJobEventCallback, and/or it can be used to return values to the joining thead.
        Returns:
        The attached object

      • join

        void join()
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Blocks the current thread until the job's eof has been reached and all events have been processed
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while blocked

      • join

        void join(long timeout,
        java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Blocks the current thread until the job's eof has been reached and all events have been processed or until the given timeout elapses
        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout duration
        unit - The timeout unit
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while blocked

      • isEOF

        boolean isEOF()
        Returns true if the eof has been reached and all events have been processed
        Returns:
        Returns true if the eof has been reached and all events have been processed
